title: [TOPI] Isolate padding option, improve decl of depthwise/conv2d/pool
body:
@Huyuwei @ZihengJiang @Laurawly @icemelon9 

- Moved the padding logic to pad.py
   - Because nested tagging is not yet supported, i removed tag scope from  conv/depthwise/pool and directly add tag by passing to compute
- Improved the declaration of conv/depthwise/pool to not rely on constant shape
- Correct the naming and input type of stride of depthwise conv

title: [TOPI] C++ topi operators
body:
Summary:
This diff implements C++ topi contributions for:
  - relu with parametrix threshold
  - pad with generic padBefore / padAfter specification
  - matmult with transposes
  - conv2d_nchw, conv2d_hwcn with runtime constant padding and strides
  - depthwise_conv2d_nchw with runtime constant padding and strides
  - group_conv2d_ngchw with runtime constant padding and strides
  - broadcast_to a broadcastable shape
  - broadcast_bop where bop is an usual binary op (+ - * / %)

Convolution padding is implemented using the pad operation.
To avoid extra memory consumption, it is generally recommended to inline the padding with the autoinliner.
Unfortunately in its current form the elemwise checks are too restrictive to allow inlining.
So this diff also proposes an extension to LHS injective (i.e. no reduction axis in the current IR design)

Test Plan:
Tested in C++ testsuite in a separate repository, I am looking for suggestions to quickly spin up some tests for tvm.

Reviewers: tqchen

Subscribers:

Tasks:

Tags:

Blame Revision:

title: Install rules for TVM.
body:
I implemented both cmake and make install rules.

One thing that these install rules do NOT do is install HalideIR,
dmlc-core and dlpack, which in practice are necessary to make use of
these headers.  Probably it would make sense to install the HalideIR
headers, since TVM is in the business of compiling those source files,
and not dlpack, which is a header only library.  I am uncertain about
dmlc-core however.

Signed-off-by: Edward Z. Yang <ezyang@fb.com>

title: [API][PASS][CODEGEN] Prefetch schedule supported
body:
* `.prefetch` schedule interface supported
    * `InjectPrefetch` pass added
        * Fix typo in `op_util.cc` to put prefetch `AttrStmt` at the correct place
        * `DomainTouch` arithmetic interface added to detect the bound of array to be fetched (Function tested, but case of `thread_extent` is untested)
    * Flatten high-dimensioned `Prefetch` IR node to `prefetch` function call when `StorageFlatten` pass (Tested)

title: [RUNTIME][RPC] Change RPCServer to Event Driven Code
body:
- Changes RPC server to event driven code, this allows RPC to use asynchrous even driven IO
- Support RPC Proxy, which allows both server and client connect to it(eliminate the need of server having unique address)
- Support RPC server in javascript with websocket

title: [RUNTIME][ABI] Flat structure arguments
body: Motivation: ABI for calling function with struct argument is not quite consistent in different standards, and it requires the front-end to have knowledge of the struct. Flat them out so the ABI is simple and only involves address and simple int

title: [RUNTIME] Add System Lib
body: System lib is a global module that contains self register functions in startup. Unlike normal dso modules which need to be loaded explicitly. It is useful in environments where dynamic loading api like dlopen is banned.
